p: In contrast to the 3a protein, M2 is an integral membrane protein of the viron and is involved in the uncoating of the viruses by permitting passage of protons across the membrane of the viron. In previous times, one of the most effective inhibitors of M2 function was amantidine, and in the past, a potent medicine for treatment of influence A infection. Meanwhile, all influenza A viruses have become amantadine-resistant, and worldwide laboratories are searching intensively for substitutes.
